business.headline: Sensex closes 64 points higher, Nifty above 25,200; SBI gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 63.57 points to end at 82.634.48, while the NSE Nifty50 gained just 16.25 points to close at 25,212.05.

Gurugram's luxury flats, flooded streets: Is real estate bubble about to burst?Gurugram's luxury real estate may be booming, but repeated rain-induced flooding is testing its long-term value. If basic infrastructure fails, even the city's glitziest addresses could lose their appeal.

Is gold losing its shine? Here's why fewer people are investing in the yellow metalEarlier, gold symbolised family pride and social standing, but today's youngsters often see gold jewellery as outdated and instead put their money into things they believe will grow faster than gold ever could.

Fewer slabs, simpler rules? Next GST Council meet may trigger overhaulThe upcoming GST Council meeting, likely to be held in August 2025 after the monsoon session of Parliament, could bring key reforms in the way GST is structured and collected.

Housing sales slide 14% as affordability pressures mount across cities: ReportThe PropTiger report, which tracks sales and launches across major cities, found that the most significant annual drop was recorded in Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR) and Pune, where sales fell by 32% and 27% respectively.

Why this IITian took up a guard's job to build Mygate, valued at Rs 1,600 croreMyGate has raised a total of $83.3 million across eight rounds. Its latest funding was in April 2023, a Series B round worth $3.29 million, putting its valuation at Rs 1,670 crore, according to Tracxn.

Tesla is finally in India. But can it go the distance?Tesla's India debut is a big milestone, but long-term success will depend on how well the company adapts to India's unique mix of pricing realities, policy expectations, and market dynamics.

Are private school fees draining India's middle class? CA shares eye-opening figuresWith fees climbing each year, parents are feeling the pinch more than ever. Maybe now is the right moment to pause, think, and ask ourselves, are we getting real value for this cost? Can we secure our kids' future without spending a fortune on fees? asks a Delhi-based CA.

SSY scheme: How your daughter can get Rs 71 lakh at 21It is a small savings scheme backed by the government, which offers high interest rates, tax benefits under Section 80C, and tax-free returns on maturity. Over 4.1 crore accounts have been opened so far under this scheme.

Good news soon for HDFC Bank shareholders? Here's all you need to knowHDFC Bank shares have delivered a 24% gain over the past year, with a year-to-date rise of nearly 13%. The stock has climbed more than 21% over the last six months, posting gains of 7% over the past three months and 4% in the previous month.

Did Ashok Leyland shares fall over 50% today? Details hereThe steep drop is the result of the company's 1:1 bonus issue, which came into effect on Wednesday. When a stock goes "ex-bonus," its price adjusts to reflect the additional shares being issued.
Sensex opens 69 points lower, Nifty below 25,200; HDFC Bank up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 197.64 points to 82,373.27, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 61.80 points to 25,134.00 as of 9:28 am.

entertainment.headline: Is The Revolutionaries Rohit Saraf's bold move to break the soft-boy mold?Actor Rohit Saraf steps away from his romantic image in the upcoming series, 'The Revolutionaries'. His role of a freedom fighter could mark his most serious and defining performance yet. If done right, this could be his chance to pivot from the chocolate boy image.

The Summer I Turned Pretty 3 Review: A dull ride through a cringe summer rom-comRelease Date:Wed Jul 16, 2025The Summer I Turned Pretty Season 3 series review: The Prime Video series returned with familiar teen romance and recycled drama, leaving viewers craving freshness in the teen rom-com genre. Despite strong music and a good-looking cast, the show struggles with pacing and emotional depth, making it feel like a repetitive rerun.

Dating or just dropping content? Ashish Chanchlani, Elli's video has fans guessingInfluencer Ashish Chanchlani teamed up with actor Elli AvrRam for a fun video on Wednesday. The video, which was shared on Instagram, sparked further interest in their relationship.

Rahul Raj Singh demands evidence from Kamya Punjabi in Pratyusha Banerjee death caseRahul Raj Singh challenges Kamya Punjabi and Neeru Shah to provide evidence or face legal consequences. He claims their actions had severely impacted his life after Pratyusha Banerjee's death.

Priyanka, Kareena, Varun and others wish Katrina Kaif on her 42nd birthdayActors Priyanka Chopra, Kareena Kapoor and Varun Dhawan, among others, extended birthday wishes to Katrina Kaif on social media. The 'Merry Christmas' actor turned 42 years old on Wednesday.

The Hunt actor Shafeeq Mustafa on playing Sivarasan, understanding LTTE politicsMalayalam actor Shafeeq Mustafa describes his role as Sivarasan in The Hunt as a career milestone and dream come true. The series has brought him widespread recognition and critical appreciation for his authentic portrayal.

Exclusive: Deepak Dobriyal says he's waiting for the right biopic, not just any role Actor Deepak Dobriyal shared his wish to play challenging real-life characters in biopics, including Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan, Pinki Pramanik, and Dhyan Chand. He also spoke about avoiding repetitive roles and choosing strong scripts with good directors and star casts.

Vicky Kaushal kisses Katrina Kaif in birthday post, and it's too cute to missVicky Kaushal shared a heartwarming birthday tribute to his 'special one', Katrina Kaif, sharing a series of adorable photos alongside a simple yet touching note that melted hearts online.

Mitti Ek Nayi Pehchan review: Ishwak Singh's film brings rural India alive onscreenRelease Date:Thu Jul 10, 2025'Mitti: Ek Nayi Pehchan' is an emotional and honest story of a man who returns to his village and reconnects with his roots. Without any drama or glamour, the show shows the real life and struggles of rural India. Read our review.

Chiranjeevi and Telugu directors mourn Ravi Teja's father Rajagopal Raju's deathTelugu actor Ravi Teja's father, Bhupathiraju Rajagopal Raju, died at the age of 90, on Tuesday. Several known personalities from the Telugu film industry, including veteran actor Chiranjeevi, offered their condolences to the 'Dhamaka' actor.

The White Lotus Season 4 in works. Details'The White Lotus' is set for a fourth season with creator Mike White exploring new filming locations, possibly warmer destinations like Mexico or Egypt. Fans can expect the show to return by late 2026 or 2027.

Anupam Kher admits marriage with Kirron Kher isn't the bestAnupam Kher, who has been married to Kirron Kher for 30 years, shared that he believes compatibility in a relationship is often given too much importance. He also revealed that he has, at times, unintentionally hurt H

Sidhu Moosewala's world tour announced 3 years after his death. What it meansSidhu Moosewala's official Instagram announced the groundbreaking 'Signed to God' world tour, set for 2026 - three years after his death. The tour aims to celebrate his legacy in a never-before-seen format.

Exclusive: How an Instagram reel got Shanaya Kapoor her first feature filmDirector Santosh Singh introduced Shanaya Kapoor in his latest romantic drama 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan'. In an exclusive interview with us, he revealed that the debutante wasn't the first choice for the role.

KJo, Samantha, Parineeti lead celeb cheers as Sidharth-Kiara welcome baby girlActors Parineeti Chopra and Samantha Ruth Prabhu were amongst several celebrities who wished Bollywood couple Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani. The two announced the birth of their baby girl on Wednesday.

Nine hospitalised after stampede at Beyonce's Atlanta Cowboy Carter showSeveral Beyonce fans were injured in a stampede caused by a shouting passenger on a train following her concert in Atlanta. The incident occurred as the crowd reacted to the disturbance.

Nithya Menen had cow dung in nails while accepting National Award. Here's whyActor Nithya Menen recently opened up about the challenges she faced for her role in Dhanush's 'Idly Kadai'. She revealed that she had cow dung on her nails, which coincided with her accepting the National Film Award.

Ramayana aims to redefine world's perception of India: Producer Namit MalhotraProducer Namit Malhotra discussed his vision for Nitesh Tiwari's 'Ramayana'. Malhotra said he wanted to centre Indian culture internationally, and decided to change Western perception of India.

Lewis Hamilton shares Jimin's Dior look, fans call it best crossover momentFormula 1 legend Lewis Hamilton shared a photo of BTS' Jimin dressed in an outfit from his Dior collection. The post sent fans into a frenzy online.

general news.headline: On death row in Yemen, Kerala nurse's fate hinges on Qisas: What is God's law?Nimisha Priya's execution in Yemen has been postponed, but her fate remains uncertain as the victim's family refuses all offers of reconciliation or blood money, insisting on Qisas, or retributive justice under Islamic law.

Top court glass partition installed, removed in months. Total cost: Rs 2.68 croreThrough the RTI filed by India Today, we have exclusively learnt that the total cost of installation of the glass panels in the Supreme Court amounted to approximately Rs 2.6 crore. The cost of its removal was estimated at Rs 8,63,700.

Who's Nato chief to warn India on trade?Nato chief Mark Rutte's warning to India over Russian oil trade crosses diplomatic lines and raises questions about the Western military alliance's role in global trade. In his attempt to be Trump's tough messenger, Rutte could risk alienating a strategic partner like India. Who's Rutte to warn a sovereign country?

Narayana Murthy's in-flight 'masterclass' with Tejasvi Surya ft 70-hour week, PMSharing details of their conversation on a Mumbai-Bengaluru flight, which Tejasvi Surya described as a 'two-hour masterclass', the BJP MP said it featured topics ranging from AI to a 70-hour work week.

Model Why? Peeling back the layers of Tesla's Indian debutThe West has once again arrived with their age-old trinkets, expecting the Third World to jump up in rapturous applause and proclaim wizardry, but will this vaguely colonial approach to selling in India work in 2025? Or should we be offended?

Pahalgam terrorists fired in air to celebrate after killing 26: EyewitnessIn the ongoing investigation into the recent Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 civilians, it has been revealed that terrorists were seen resorting to celebratory firing immediately following the carnage.

Pakistan awaits another debut as Imran Khan's sons take to political pitchImran Khan's two sons have so far kept politics at arm's length while living thousands of miles away in London. They are likely to lead a mega protest rally in Lahore, demanding the release of their father.
Kota: How India's coaching capital collapsedThe government is now intent on an education that promotes critical thinking rather than the rote learning coaching institutes foster

Happy World Snake Day, dear relativesSnakes are a misunderstood and feared lot, though 75% of them found in India are non-venomous. On World Snake Day, paying tribute to a species that's more venomous and strikes without provocation, our relatives.
SSVM Institutions: From Cradle to CosmosForging Futures with Foresight, Flair, and Faith

Why no cameras in cockpits? Air India crash sparks debate, demandThe fuel-switch report in the Air India Boeing 787 crash probe has sparked a demand for a cockpit video recorder. The NTSB of the US that probes air crashes has for years batted for one. If cockpit voice recorders are part of the black boxes of planes, what has kept cockpit video recorders, which would aid air crash investigations, from being installed?

UP woman kills 5-year-old daughter, consumes drugs with lover, has sex next to bodyInitially, the woman accused her husband of killing their daughter so that he could go to jail, and she would have no problem living with her lover. She later confessed to her crime.

Can Zohran Mamdani say anything without 'ultimately'? He admits in fun videoIn a fun video on Instagram, Zohran Mamdani addressed feedback from his communications team about his frequent use of the word "ultimately."

Woman gangraped by 7 men in moving car, held captive for 11 days in RajasthanAccording to the complaint filed by the survivor's husband, the incident began on the night of April 25, when the woman went outside her home to relieve herself. She was allegedly forced into a Bolero vehicle by three men.

No mercy for Nimisha Priya, says brother of man killed by Kerala nurse in YemenTalal Abdo Mehdi's family has refused to pardon Kerala nurse Nimisha Priya, demanding execution under Sharia law. Her execution in the murder case of Mehdi in Yemen has been postponed as Indian authorities push for last-minute negotiations.

Was Air India crash mechanical, accidental or…? FAQs answeredThe preliminary crash probe report has raised critical questions around how fuel supply to the engines got cut off. INDIA TODAY looks at the scenarios

Stuck in a thought spiral? Here's how to break the loopIt takes just one thought to fall into a spiral. The unending loop of rumination and overanalysis can build stress and anxiety in ways you might not even realise. An expert shares how to navigate overthinking.

Madhya Pradesh man rides bike with cobra wrapped around neck, dies of snakebiteA snake rescuer from Madhya Pradesh's Guna district died after a cobra he had draped around his neck for a display bit him.

Put me in detention camp: Mamata Banerjee marches over 'targeting' of migrantsThe march, in the heart of Kolkata, was held in protest against the alleged harassment of Bengali-speaking people in BJP-ruled states.

Israeli man seeks custody after daughters, Russian mother found in Karnataka caveAn Israeli man, Dror Goldstein, has appealed for the shared custody of his two daughters after their mother, a Russian national, was found living with them in a remote cave near Gokarna, Karnataka. Meanwhile, the Foreigners Regional Registration Office (FRRO) is preparing to deport the mother over visa violations.

India's obesity crisis tied to diet more than exerciseReducing calories from ultra-processed foods, improving access to whole foods, and better understanding how these products affect our bodies might help address obesity on a global scale.

Visa is privilege, not a right: US State Dept warns of deportationsThe US Department of State has warned that visas are a privilege, not a right, and can be revoked if holders violate US laws. Arrests for crimes like assault or domestic violence can lead to deportation and future ineligibility. The warning comes after a series of advisories in recent weeks amid heightened scrutiny and enforcement surrounding US immigration policy.

Not a child to understand what favour I need, Odisha professor 'told' studentThe internal complaint committee had advised the professor, accused of sexually harassing the student who died after setting herself on fire, to modify his behaviour and teaching methods.

I am innocent: UP's Chhangur Baba on mass religious conversion allegationsUttar Pradesh's Chhangur Baba, the alleged mastermind behind the mass religious conversion case, has broken his silence on the allegations.

sports.headline: Las Vegas Freestyle chess: Praggnanandhaa grouped with Carlsen, Gukesh opts outR Praggnanandhaa will face Magnus Carlsen as the young Indian grandmaster has been grouped with the World No.1 for the Las Vegas Freestyle chess. D Gukesh will be missing the tournament.

Boland rewarded with career-best ranking after hat-trick in Jamaica TestWI vs AUS: Australian speedster Scott Boland reached a career-high ranking of No.6 in Tests after he took a hat-trick in the second innings of the Jamaica Test.

Lamine Yamal in trouble? Spanish group vows legal actionLamine Yamal's 18th birthday party has drawn criticism for hiring people with dwarfism as entertainment. The incident raises serious questions about discrimination and the dignity of people with disabilities in Spain.

Michael Vaughan left fuming as England docked points for Lord's Test slow over rateMichael Vaughan was left fuming as England were docked points for maintaining a slow over rate during the Lord's Test as India escaped without facing any penalty. The Lord's Test saw many interruptions over the first two days which affected the number of overs bowled.

Virat Kohli's passion unmatched, he should come back to Test cricket: Madan LalMadan Lal, the 1983 World Cup hero, has expressed a heartfelt wish that has struck a chord with cricket fans across the nation—to see Virat Kohli return to Test cricket.

King Charles meets Team India, asks about Akash Deep's sisterThe Indian cricket teams met King Charles during their England tour. Charles asked about Akash Deep's sister, who is currently under treatment for cancer.

Joe Root dethrones Harry Brook to reclaim top spot in ICC Test rankingsEngland star Joe Root reclaimed the No.1 spot in ICC Test batting rankings after his century at Lord's, overtaking teammate Harry Brook and marking his eighth time at the top of the global charts.

ICC AGM: Two-tier Test system, T20 World Cup expansion to be discussedThe ICC's four-day AGM starting on Thursday will focus on key topics like the proposed two-tier Test system, T20 World Cup expansion, and new member ratifications. With the 2025-27 World Test Championship underway, discussions will center on funding and promotion-relegation rules within the two-tier format.

Coach Sanath Jayasuriya dismisses pressure talk following 2nd T20I lossSri Lanka head coach Sanath Jayasuriya insisted on Tuesday that the team is not under pressure despite their embarrassing 83-run loss to Bangladesh in the second T20I.

With the 2025-27 World Test Championship underway, discussions will center on funding and promotion-relegation rules within the two-tier format.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
